text: The perineal sponge is a spongy cushion of tissue and blood vessels found in the lower genital area of women. It sits between the vaginal opening and rectum and is internal to the perineum and perineal body. ==Functions== The perineal sponge is composed of erectile tissue; during arousal, it becomes swollen with blood compressing the outer third of the vagina along with the vestibular bulbs and urethral sponge thereby creating a tighter fit and additional stimulation for the penis.Levine S. et al. "Handbook of Clinical Sexuality", page 180 Brunner-Routledge 2003 ==Sexual stimulation== The perineal sponge is erogenous tissue encompassing a large number of nerve endings, and can, therefore, be stimulated through the back wall of the vagina or the top wall of the rectum.Chalker R. "The Clitoral Truth", page 46 Seven Stories Press 2000 Referring to the G-Spot, this area is sometimes called the PS-spot (perineal sponge spot). ==References== Category:Human female reproductive system
